citation.article-title: Vibrio trachuri sp. nov., a new species isolated from diseased Japanese horse mackerel.

p.s: Description of Vibrio trachuri sp. nov.
Vibrio trachuri (tra'chu.ri. Lat. gen. of masc. n. trachuri, derived from Trachurus japonicus, Japanese horse mackerel, from which strains were isolated)
Grows well at 30 C in 1% peptone containing 3-7% NaCl.
Lysine decarboxylase positive and ornithine decarboxylase negative.
Grows on BTB teepol or TCBS medium which are selective media for Vibrio.
DNA base composition is 45.4-47.8 mol% G+C (47.8% in type strain).
Type strain is T9210 [deposited as JCM9677 in Japan Collectionof Microorganisms, Institute of Physical and Chemical Research (Riken), Wako, Saitama, Japan].
